Package edu.kirkwood.controller

Class TemperatureCalculator

java.lang.Object
edu.kirkwood.controller.TemperatureCalculator
public class TemperatureCalculator extends Object
TemperatureCalculator is a class that provides methods to parse and validate user input, and perform temperature calculations such as conversion, addition, and substraction based on Temperature model.

    • start

      public static void start()

    • parseTemperatureInput

      public edu.kirkwood.model.Temperature parseTemperatureInput(String input)
      Parses a user input string and creates a Temperature object. The expected input format is: "value scale" (20 F).
      Parameters:
      input - the user input string with number and scale
      Returns:
      a Temperature object
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input is invalid or improperly formatted.

    • convertTemperature

      public String convertTemperature(edu.kirkwood.model.Temperature temp, String targetScale)
      Converts a given Temperature to the specified target scale.
      Parameters:
      temp - the Temperature object to convert
      targetScale - The Target scale ("C", "F", or "K")
      Returns:
      the converted temperature as a formatted string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the scale is invalid

    • add

      public edu.kirkwood.model.Temperature add(edu.kirkwood.model.Temperature t1, edu.kirkwood.model.Temperature t2)
      Adds two temperatures objects together The result is returned in the scale of the first temperature
      Parameters:
      t1 - the first temperature
      t2 - the second temperature
      Returns:
      the resulting temperature after addition
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null.

    • subtract

      public edu.kirkwood.model.Temperature subtract(edu.kirkwood.model.Temperature t1, edu.kirkwood.model.Temperature t2)
      Substracts the second temperature from the first
      Parameters:
      t1 - the first temperature
      t2 - the second temperature
      Returns:
      the resulting temperature after substraction
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null.
